channel.title: PHP Coder
channel.description: Its quite a big favour to ask I guess and im not to sure in how I can repay it but would anyone be willing to do the code to a HTML web form for me? If anyone is interested then PM me and ill send you the form. It only has 16 fields, 4 are drop down menus, 3 are yes no radio buttons. Also you would have to be able to put in a hidden field which sends the date and time of when the data was submitted. Thanks

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:25, topic:133476”][php]$date = date(“d/m/Y H:i.s”);
$ip = $_SERVER[‘REMOTE_ADDR’];
$title = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname]");
$firstname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname2]");
$lastname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[address]");
$address = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[name1]");
$town = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[town]");
$county = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[county]");
$postcode = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[postcode]");
$phone = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[phone]");
$email = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[email]");[/php]

can be done so much easier:
[php]foreach($_POST as $key=>$val) {
$_POST[$key] = htmlentities($val);//safer than specialchars
}[/php][/quote]

cool thanks, i never thought of doing it that way

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @Kimber Kimber
item.description:
@Kimber wrote:

Yeah Legit, the code doesnt work, dont worry I dont feel like I need it. But if your bored enough to try and fix it then go for it :D. When you load the page an error box comes up with problem, then if you click submit the error is that no credit card has been selected,

Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[php]$date = date(“d/m/Y H:i.s”);
$ip = $_SERVER[‘REMOTE_ADDR’];
$title = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname]");
$firstname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname2]");
$lastname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[address]");
$address = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[name1]");
$town = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[town]");
$county = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[county]");
$postcode = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[postcode]");
$phone = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[phone]");
$email = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[email]");[/php]

can be done so much easier:
[php]foreach($_POST as $key=>$val) {
$_POST[$key] = htmlentities($val);//safer than specialchars
}[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

<script type="text/javascript">
function validateForm() {
	if (registrationform = document.forms[0]) {
		var errorcode = '';
		if (registrationform.title.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your title.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.firstname.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your first name.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.lastname.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your last name.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.address.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your address.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.town.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your town.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.county.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your county.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.postcode.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your postal code.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.phone.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your phone number.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.email.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please type in your email address.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.bankname1.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please select your first bank.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.bankname2.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please select your second bank.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.bankname3.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please select your third bank.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.cardname1.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please your credit card status.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.cardname2.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please your second credit card status.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.cardname3.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please your third credit card status.\n';
		}
		if (registrationform.hearaboutus.value == undefined) {
			errorcode += 'Error: Please tell us where you heard about us.\n';
		}
		if (errorcode.length > 0) {
			alert(errorcode);
			return false;
		} else {
			alert('You\'re fine.');
		}
	} else {
		alert('Error 1');
	}
}

if (document.forms[0]) { document.forms[0].onsubmit = validateForm; } else { alert('problem'); }
</script>

Here’s the JS… you can stick it in the head, but it totally doesn’t work. It can’t access the form node for some reason. Idk.

Read full topic

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @Kimber Kimber
item.description:
@Kimber wrote:

Well thanks for all of the work, toke 3 peoples codes but its finally working, here is the final code for future reference:

[code]<?php
mysql_connect(“localhost”,“admin”,"********");
mysql_select_db(“bank”);

if (isset($_POST[‘submit’])) {
if(!isset($_POST[‘title’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Title.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘firstname’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Firstname.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘lastname’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Lastname.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘address’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Address.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘town’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Town.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘county’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your County.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘postcode’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Postcode.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘phone’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Phone number.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘email’])) { die(‘Error: Please insert your Email address.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘bankname1’])) { die(‘Error: Please select your Bank.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘bankname2’])) { die(‘Error: Please select your Bank.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘bankname3’])) { die(‘Error: Please select your Bank.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘cardname1’])) { die(‘Error: Please define weather you have a credit card.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘cardname2’])) { die(‘Error: Please define weather you have a second credit card.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘cardname3’])) { die(‘Error: Please define weather you have a third credit card.
’); }
if(!isset($_POST[‘hearaboutus’])) { die(‘Error: Please tell us how you heard of us.
’); }
}

$date = date(“d/m/Y H:i.s”);
$title = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘title’]);
$firstname = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘firstname’]);
$lastname = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘lastname’]);
$address = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘address’]);
$town = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘town’]);
$county = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘county’]);
$postcode = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘postcode’]);
$phone = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘phone’]);
$email = htmlspecialchars($_POST[‘email’]);

mysql_query(“INSERT INTO bank (id, title, firstname, lastname, address, town, county, postcode, phone, email, bankname1, bankname2, bankname3, cardname1, cardname2, cardname3, hearaboutus, date) VALUES (’’, ‘$title’, ‘$firstname’, ‘$lastname’, ‘$address’, ‘$town’, ‘$county’, ‘$postcode’, ‘$phone’, ‘$email’, ‘$_POST[bankname1]’, ‘$_POST[bankname2]’, ‘$_POST[bankname3]’, ‘$_POST[cardname1]’, ‘$_POST[cardname2]’, ‘$_POST[cardname3]’,’$_POST[hearaboutus]’,’$date’);”) or die (mysql_error());

?>
[/code]

Thanks to everyone that helped!

Read full topic

<?php @mysql_connect("localhost","admin","********"); @mysql_select_db("bank"); if (isset($_POST['submit'])) { if($_POST['title'])) { die('Error: Please insert your title.
\n'); } if($_POST['firstname'])) { die('Error: Please insert your first name.
\n'); } if($_POST['lastname'])) { die('Error: Please insert your last name.

\n'); } if($_POST['hearaboutus'])) { die('Error: Please tell us how you heard of us.
\n'); } } $date = date("d/m/Y H:i.s"); $ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR']; $title = htmlspecialchars($_POST[title]); $firstname = htmlspecialchars($_POST['firstname']); $lastname = htmlspecialchars($_POST['lastname']); $address = htmlspecialchars($_POST['address']); $town = htmlspecialchars($_POST['town']); $county = htmlspecialchars($_POST['county']); $postcode = htmlspecialchars($_POST['postcode']); $phone = htmlspecialchars($_POST['phone']); $email = htmlspecialchars($_POST['email']); mysql_query("INSERT INTO bank (`id`, `title`, `firstname`, `lastname`, `address`, `town`, `county`, `postcode`, `phone`, `email`, `bankname1`, `bankname2`, `bankname3`, `cardname1`, `cardname2`, `cardname3`, `hearaboutus`, `date`, `ip`) VALUES ('', '$title', '$firstname', '$lastname', '$address', '$town', '$county', '$postcode', '$phone', '$email', '$_POST[bankname1]', '$_POST[bankname2]', '$_POST[bankname3]', '$_POST[cardname1]', '$_POST[cardname2]', '$_POST[cardname3]', '$date', '$ip');") or die (mysql_error()); ?>

[/php][/td][/tr]
[/table][/quote]

why do you want the code to die?? that means you cant see the rest of the page…

i did the variable exrtensions wrong because i havent used that method in a while…

[php]

<?php include("connect.php"); if(isset($_POST[submit])) { $continue = true; $submited = true; } $error_text = ""; if($_POST[firstname]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your title.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[firstname2]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your first name.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[lastname]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your last name.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[address]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your Adress.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[town]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert the town here you live.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[county]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert the county where you live.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[postcode]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your postcode.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[phone]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your phone number.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[email]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please insert your email adress.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[bankname]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please select your bank.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[card1]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please define weather you have a credit card.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[card2]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please define weather you have a second credit card.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[card3]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please define weather you have a third credit card.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($_POST[howhearaboutus]==NULL && $submited) { $error_text .= "Error: Please tell us how you heard of us.
\n"; $continue = false; } if($continue) { $date = date("d/m/Y H:i.s"); $ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR']; $title = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname]"); $firstname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[firstname2]"); $lastname = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[address]"); $address = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[name1]"); $town = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[town]"); $county = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[county]"); $postcode = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[postcode]"); $phone = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[phone]"); $email = htmlspecialchars("$_POST[email]"); mysql_query("INSERT INTO bank (`id`, `title`, `firstname`, `lastname`, `adress`, `town`, `county`, `postcode`, `phone`, `email`, `bankname1`, `bankname2`, `bankname3`, `cardname1`, `cardname2`, `cardname3`, `hearaboutus`, `date`, `ip`) VALUES ('', '$title', '$firstname', '$lastname', '$address', '$town', '$county', '$postcode', '$phone', '$email', '$_POST[bankname]', '$_POST[bankname2]', '$_POST[bankname3]', '$_POST[card1]', '$_POST[card2]', '$_POST[card3]', '$date', '$ip');") or die (mysql_error()); echo "Thank you for filling out our form"; } if(!$continue) { echo "$error_text"; ?>

//html here…

<?php } ?>

[/php]

item.title: PHP Coder

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

You need quotes around the post name.

$_POST[‘phone’] for example.

I could have done this, why didn’t you pm me back? Anyway, you should have used javascript as a first-step validation tool rather than PHP.

item.title: PHP Coder
item.dc:creator: @Kimber Kimber
item.description:
@Kimber wrote:

OnlyOneRule came up with this code:

<?php
@mysql_connect("localhost","admin","********"); 
@mysql_select_db("bank");

if(isset($_POST[submit]))
{
 $continue = true;
 $submited = true;
}

	if($_POST[title]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Title";
		$continue = false;
	}
	
	if($_POST[firstname]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Firstname.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[lastname]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Lastname.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[address]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Adrress.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[town]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Town.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[county]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your County.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[postcode]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Postcode.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[phone]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your Phone number.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[email]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please insert your email adress.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[bankname1]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please select your bank.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[bankname2]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please select your bank.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[bankname3]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please select your bank.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[cardname1]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please define weather you have a credit card.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[cardname2]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please define weather you have a second credit card.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
		if($_POST[cardname3]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please define weather you have a third credit card.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	if($_POST[howhearaboutus]==NULL && $submited)
	{
		$error_text = ."<font color=\"#ff0000\">Error</font>: Please tell us how you heard of us.<br />\n";
		$continue = false;
	}
	
		if($continue)
		{
		$date = date("d/m/Y H:i.s");
		$ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'];
		$title = htmlspecialchars($_POST[title]);
		$firstname = htmlspecialchars($_POST[firstname]);
		$lastname = htmlspecialchars($_POST[lastname]);
		$address = htmlspecialchars($_POST[address]);
		$town = htmlspecialchars($_POST[town]);
		$county = htmlspecialchars($_POST[county]);
		$postcode = htmlspecialchars($_POST[postcode]);
		$phone = htmlspecialchars($_POST[phone]);
		$email = htmlspecialchars($_POST[email]);
		
mysql_query("INSERT INTO bank (`title`,`firstname`,`lastname`,`address`,`town`,`county`,`postcode`,`phone`,`email`,`bankname1`,`bankname2`,`bankname3`,`cardname1`,`cardname2`,`cardname3`,`howhearaboutus`,`date`,`ip`) VALUES ('$title','$firstname','$lastname','$address','$town','$county','$postcode','$phone','$email','$_POST[bankname1]','$_POST[bankname2]','$_POST[bankname3]','$_POST[cardname1]','$_POST[cardname2]','$_POST[cardname3]','$date','$ip')");
	
		echo "Thank you for filling out our form";
		}

		if(!$continue)
		{
			echo "$error_text";

?>

It loads a blank page… I cant see what is wrong, the fields that are in the table are:

title
firstname
lastname
address
town
county
postcode
phone
email
bankname1
bankname2
bankname3
cardname1
cardname2
cardname3
howhearaboutus

Any ideas/anything missing?
